item.description:
Report X-2024072171

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 23rd a package was brought to one of our stations. The Astra label was removed causing us to open the package looking for more information. This led us to discover the package contained UN3480 Lithium Ion Batteries, 9. There were no indications on the outside of the package that a battery was inside the package. The package is being held pending further disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024070641
item.description:
Report E-2024070641

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: CHARLOTTESVILLE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When the Veolia employees arrived at Martha Jefferson hospital and opened the back of the truck, they discovered that the load had shifted during transportation. This caused a 12 gallon medical waste bin from Sentara to be crushed and the lid popped off. It is estimated that less than a pint of liquid spilled onto the floor and the surrounding containers. The spill was contained to the back of the truck. There were no injuries as a result of the spill. The spill was cleaned and the containers affected were overpacked without further incident.

item.description:
Report X-2024072173

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/22/2024 at approximately 1100, Dangeorus Goods Administration received a call from Employee 261690 at the hub facility in Anchorage, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing two bottles of retail perfume. The package appeared to have been crushed during transit, resulting in spillage. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report E-2024070645
item.description:
Report E-2024070645

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 23, 2024, at 1039 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Orlando, Florida regarding the release of Eucalyptus Polybractea. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that there was 1 damaged 55-gallon DM of Eucalyptus Polybractea, which was wrapped in plastic to stop the leak. No puddling was found outside of the plastic wrapping where the drum was located. Contractors secured the drum with additional wrapping and placed it in a 95-gallon overpack to be staged onsite. No waste was generated from addressing this release during the ER response.

item.title: Report E-2024070642
item.description:
Report E-2024070642

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-20
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 20, 2024, at 1605 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Albuquerque, New Mexico regarding the release of Ecolab Aqua Balance Pool and Spa Disinfectant. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 15 gallons of Ecolab Aqua Balance Pool and Spa Disinfectant (UN1791, 8, III) from (1)15-gallon plastic drum. The release was caused by a puncture from a pallet due to a load shift and contained to a 3ft x 25ft area of the trailer floor, and a 4ft x 2ft area of asphalt beneath the trailer. Contractors placed the damaged empty drum in an overpack then cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The overpack was secured in the trailer to be forwarded on to the original consignee. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • Description: SRIX 32187 released due to and open liquid valve, and the secondary closure plug was less than tool tight. Car was discover leaking in Ogden UT. Upon investigation there was an ice block formed around the valve and the liquid valve was found open and the secondary closure plug was less than tool tight. Valve would not seal after closure and secondary plug was secured to prevent further release. Car is on hold awaiting OTMA.

  • City: RICHFIELD

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazmat was found at door 125 in the load end ready to go to the next load point. The outbound sort manager walked passed it and noticed a very strong odor coming from the box. QA was contacted immediately to inspect the box. I noticed a little wet spot on one of the bottom corners of the package and brought it over to the office in a lined tote for further inspection. The inner drum seamed to have a poor quality closure that caused some of the contents to spill out and make it a little noticeable to the naked eye. Once the package was fully opened, the corrugated liner seamed to be wet also to confirm that the hazmat was damaged and could have possibly been damaged while it was on the vehicle when the driver returned from the pick up but could have dried do to the Acetone & Isopropyl Alcohol ingredient that makes up the product.

  • Description: Driver was doing pre trip and noticed a couple drips coming from trailer at approximately 0830 ct. Drive put down some absorbent then called the company's emergency number. The team was dispatched to the location arriving around 1100ct. They began unloading the trailer and found a 55 gallon drum with a pinhole in it. The drum did not look damaged other than the pin hole. The team then put the drum into a salvage drume and the material was cleaned up with absorbent and the disposed of in the appropriate manor. The clean up was completed by 1400ct. There was approximately 1 cup released on the floor of the trailer.

Clean Harbors out of Tualatin, OR, were already onsite performing tank cleaning and will assist with the remediation of this release. They will recover the absorbent pads deployed by the Loves Personnel and then pressure wash the impacted area and recover the risen waters utilizing a vacuum truck. It was reported a nearby drain basin was impacted, but they were told it led to the onsite OWS unit. Clean Harbors estimates 100 gallons released impacting an approximate 75yd by 40yd area of asphalt and concrete.

item.title: Report E-2024070065
item.description:
Report E-2024070065

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: ASHTABULA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5010
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/26/2024, at 1048 hours, personnel in the CSXT Ashtabula Yard discovered TILX 113642, a residue tank car of Hydrochloric Acid, leaking from the protective housing area. The car was isolated and the shipper, INEOS, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-0626-143). EnviroServe, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the primary liquid line closure flange not properly prepared for transportation. Contractor personnel properly secured the closure and decontaminated the car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- Jeanne Kochevar (440-228-8373).

  • Description: Driver noticed at one of his stops( Boarders poultry supply) that there was a drip down one of the legs of an IBC metal tote tank. Driver called Safety, Hazmat one was called to assist in making all the necessary calls for the state of Lousianna. Costal Chemical was the shipper they came out to where our driver was located to transfer the contents of the damaged tote to a new tote. State police was on scene and reported that the leak was due to a weld and no fault of the carrier where the leg was mounted and that all calls were made and time frames were met.

item.description:
Report X-2024072081

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ANCHORAGE, ALASKA ONE GROUND TO ALASKA PACKAGE FROM CALIFORNIA WAS INSPECTED DUE TO SECURITY HEARING A RATTLE AEROSOL SOUND COMING FROM THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED SEVEN INNER BOXES WITH FLAMMABLE GAS 2.1 PICTOGRAMS AND UN2037. EACH OF THESE SEVEN INNER BOXES CONTAIN TWELVE X 10.14 OUNCE CANS OF NEON QUINTUPLE REFINED PREMIUM BUTANE LIGHTER REFILLS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON ONE UPS FLIGHT FROM ONT TO ANC.

item.title: Report X-2024072084
item.description:
Report X-2024072084

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT APPROXIMATELY 20:45 THE SUPERVISOR FROM THE PD 11 CALLED THE DMP CAGE TO INFORM THAT THERE WAS A LEAKING HAZMAT IN DOOR 112. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER DONNING PROPER PPE ARRIVED ON SCENE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. UPON ENTERING THE TRAILER THEY DISCOVERED A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE LYING ON ITS SIDE. AFTER REFERRING TO THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THEY ACTED ACCORDINGLY. THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON OPENING THE SINGLEWALL FIBREBOARD BOX IT WAS DETERMINED THE CAUSE OF THE LEAKAGE WAS A LOOSE CAP. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN DISPOSED OF ACCORDING TO THE DMP FLOW CHART AND PROPER APPENDIX.

Both drums were staged onsite.

The crew utilized absorbents and degreasing agent to remediate the impacted site. The damaged jugs were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums. item.description:
Report I-2024070078

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: New Orleans
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STG LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 7 According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While intermodal container was staged at the STG Logistics yard, a leak was discovered coming from the back of container. Area was isolated and United States Environmental Services was dispatched to perform cleanup. Louisiana DEQ responded to assess. Upon opening container, one 55-gallon drum was discovered with a faulty seam. Approximately 1 gallon had released from the drum, which impacted the container floor and minimal amount to gravel surface beneath. Due to the nature of the product, the product evaporated upon contact with the air, and no cleanup was required. Absorbent pads were utilized as a precautionary measure, damaged drum was overpacked into an 85-gallon overpack, and all cleanup debris was placed within overpack drum. The overpack drum was placed back in the container, pending disposition. There was no threat or impact to state waters. There were no injuries or exposures reported.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of product released to a 1 x 1 area of the gravel lot due to a pinhole puncture or faulty valve. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents and pads. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly and 35-gallon poly drums. The waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024070061
item.description:
Report I-2024070061

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: Beaumont
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARTIN TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Loaded trailer was on our yard in Beaumont, TX when it was discovered to be Ieaking from a flange. The emergency shut off was used in hopes of stopping the leak. This attempt did not work because the product was actually coming from the flange above the external valve. Proper PPE was donned and the pressure was released from the top of the trailer. This slowed the leak down enough for our shop supervisor to don the proper PPE and check all the bolts and nuts on the flange. We found two nuts were very loose. These nuts were tightened up and the leak was completely stop. After our immediate investigation was completed, we discover that the two nuts that were lose had two lock washers that had flattened out not allowing the nuts to stay tight.

item.title: Report I-2024030011
item.description:
Report I-2024030011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-27T00:37:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTH PARK MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8964
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On Monday February 5, 2024, at approximately 2:11 pm (CST), a flatbed semi-truck was transporting a mixed load of commercial waste when a fire was reported by the carriers driver. The driver immediately pulled over to the side of the interstate. The incident occurred on Interstate 40 west bound near mile marker 204, near White Bridge Rd in Nashville Tennessee. The Nashville Fire Department responded to the scene and extinguished the fire within minutes of notification. The fire involved a single package on a load of low-level and mixed low-level radioactive waste being shipped for disposal. The package that caught fire consisted of a soft-sided 90 cubic foot (3.5 yd3) multi-layered bag constructed of a 10 oz. geotextile non-woven polypropylene inner liner, with a double 20 mil high density polyethylene (HDPE) inner and outer liners with 4 mm rigid fiberboard in between the two 18 mil HOPE liners, meeting the General Design Criteria (49 CFR 173.410) and shipped in accordance with 49 CFR 173.427(b)(4) as an Exclusive Use Shipment. The waste was being hauled on a flatbed semi-truck that had three separate containers placed on it. The fire was limited to the one soft-sided container towards the rear of the trailer. There was only minimal damage to the exterior of the other two containers (smoke) and no fire damage to the trailer. The items in the affected container consisted of both facility and customer waste with the majority being used personal protective equipment, facility trash, crushed drums, and other miscellaneous waste materials that were being transported to Texas for disposal. The transport vehicle was placarded with Class 7 Radioactive placards. The cause of the fire was not due to any defect or failure with the carriers truck or trailer, or any action of the carriers driver. Within hours, the shipper sent a response team to the incident site to secure the packaging for shipment back to its origin.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHW experienced a UN1814 Combi Cleaner Ultra Concentrated Detergent release from multiple 2.5-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors for containment and cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 cups of product released to a 4 x 4 area of the concrete dock floor. The caps on several jugs were loose, causing the release. The caps were tightened, the jugs were wiped down, and then re-stacked for shipment on. Absorbents were then deployed to clean the dock. All impacted absorbents and debris were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LAO experienced a UN1993 Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 release from a 330-gallon metal tote when delivering to the customer. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to the tote body and an 8 x 8 area of the concrete lot. The tote fell off of the lift gate due to improper handling, resulting in the release. The tote was up righted and wiped down with a solvent and pads. The impacted concrete was cleaned with a solvent and pads to remove the material. Granular absorbents were also deployed and worked in. The impacted pads and absorbents were then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was transported back to XPO in Amarillo, TX for terminal personnel to manage.

THE RESPONDER USED THE DECISION TREE AND AFTER LOOKING AT THE BOX SAW THAT IT WAS A CORROSIVE. USING SODIUM BICARBONATE TO NEUTRALIZE SPILL ON FLOOR. TAKING THE BOTTLES ON THE SLIDE AND PUT THEM IN A SPILL LINED TREY. CLEANED UP SPILL ON FLOOR AND TOOK SOURCE BOX AND CONTAMINATED BOXES TO DMP CAG FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024070509
item.description:
Report E-2024070509

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHG experienced a UN2582 Hydrex 3250 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5 cup of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the tote lid and body only due to a defective cap. The contractors replaced the cap with a new vented cap and wiped the tote down. A slosh test was conducted, and the tote was confirmed to be no longer leaking and was secured for shipment on. The impacted pads and cap were placed into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On July 15, 2024, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of NA1993 were crushed in transit and released approximately forty (40) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (ACS) to remediate the impacted site. ACS personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted trailer. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA notified ERTS of a cargo release of 1 cup of UN1263 "Spectrum Paint Admiral Pre Cat Lacquer" released from a 1-gallon metal pail. The release impacted the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they confirmed they felt comfortable that terminal personnel could clean the release with PPE available on-site. The damaged pail and impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024070565
item.description:
Report E-2024070565

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XHG contacted ERTS regarding several fallen boxes containing hazardous product, Contact-64. The boxes fell during transit as a result of improper loading / inadequate preparation for transportation. In total, (8) boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon plastic bottles of Contact 64 were damaged and/or impacted by released product. A Contractor estimated that 2-gallons of corrosive liquid released onto adjacent product, packaging including cardboard and shrink wrap/bubble-wrap, and the wooden trailer floor in a 8x4 area. Citric Acid was applied as a neutralizer and oil dry was laid down to absorb the release. Two drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.description:

  • City: CHESTER
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO- NRM contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 55-gallon steel drum containing hazardous product, NE-101 Nitroethane. The drum was punctured by a forklift blade resulting in an estimated release of 8-gallons of product. The wooden trailer floor was impacted in a 12' x 8.5' area. A Contractor contained and cleaned-up the release using oil dry. The damaged leaking drum was overpacked into an 85-gallon DM. The impacted oil dry and cut-up impacted pallet was containerized into one 55-gallon DF for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately half a gallon (.5) of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a puncture from a sharp object. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized the recovered material, PPE and the damaged drum in to one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024071824
item.description:
Report X-2024071824

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ANCHORAGE, ALASKA, ONE GROUND TO ALASKA PACKAGE REQUIRED A REWRAP DUE TO BEING WET FROM RAINWATER. GROUND TO ALASKA IS A LOWER RATE OFFERED BUT THE PACKAGE MUST TRANSPORT IN THE AIR NETWORK. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE INNER BOX MARKED CARTRIDGES, SMALL ARMS, UN0012, 1.4S WITH A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARK. THIS BOX CONTAINS (25) INNER BOXES CONTAINING (20) FRONTIER 62 GR FULL METAL JACKET CARTRIDGES. THIS PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINS (7) 50 ROUND BOXES OF WINCHESTER 9MM 124 GRAIN FULL METAL JACKET CARTRIDGES AND (3) 550 ROUND BOXES OF RIMFIRE TARGET CARTRIDGES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024071684
item.description:
Report X-2024071684

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: HONOLULU
  • State: HI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: X-RAY EXAMINATION OF ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM USA TO NEW ZEALAND REVEALED POSSIBLE ANOMALIES INCONSISTENT WITH THE INVOICE DESCRIPTION OF KEYBOARD. THE PACKAGE WAS FLAGGED FOR FURTHER EXAMINATION BY U.S. CUSTOMS AND BORDER PROTECTION (CBP) ANTI-TERRORISM/CONTRABAND ENFORCEMENT TEAM (ATCET) AIR HONOLULU OFFICERS. WHILE THE OFFICERS WERE ATTEMPTING TO OPEN THE KEYBOARD AN UKNOWN CHEMICAL REACTION OCCURRED WITHIN THE KEYBOARD. THE CENTER OF THE KEYBOARD BEGAN TO SMOKE, MELT AND BURN. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT Y85681, THE UPS STORE, 1191 HUNTINGTON DRIVE, DUARTE CA 91010. PER THE ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS - SECTION II OF IATA PACKING INSTRUCTION 967, NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ARE REQUIRED.

item.title: Report E-2024070550
item.description:
Report E-2024070550

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: DICKINSON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 16, 2024, a pallet of 1-gallon pails of paint related material tipped over during unloading and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the pavement. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel deployed granular absorbents and absorbent pads to the paint material impacted pavement and collected it with hand tools. All damaged product were containerized into eight (8) 55-gallon steel drums. Crews collected all spent absorbents and containerized them into three (3) 55-gallon steel drums for transport and disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024070525

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Individual Not A Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 3 poly totes were received these totes were placed into the box sideways. the totes are as wide as they are long. When going to retrieve the 2nd tote the forklift operator pushed his forks in too far and forked the drum of cardinal bag that was behind the tote. In house cleanup wad used to clean up the spill. the spill was contained and managed correctly. no material went offsite. The root cause of the spill being that the totes were placed into the truck sideways this was communicated with the people who loaded the truck to not do that in future.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 16, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1791 was punctured in transit and released approximately 100-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Green Site Services (GSS) to remediate the impacted site. The crew containerized all impacted pallets into one (1) cubic yard box for disposal. GSS utilized absorbents and neutralizer to remediate the impacted site. All impacted materials were containerized in five (5) 55-gallon drums.

  • Description: On July 16, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of ink was punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI deployed granular absorbents on the impacted asphalt outside of the trailer as well as around the damaged container. The crew utilized hand tools and a drum vac to empty out the remaining material into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and collected the spent absorbents into one (1) separate 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER, RESPONDED TO A CALL FOR DOOR 132 IN THE UNLOAD. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE IN FULL PPE AND WAS INFORMED BY THE UNLOADER OF THE LOCATION OF THE LEAKER. RESPONDER APPROACHED THE LEAKING PACKAGE TO DISCOVER THAT IT WAS A DECLARED HAZMAT. PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A SPILL TRAY, PLACED THE LEAKING HAZMAT ON SPILL CART, REMOVED ANY OTHER TAINTED PACKAGES, AND CLEANED THE SCENE ACCORDING TO HIS RESPONSE SHEET.

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 12, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was damaged and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. ES&H personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged pail were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070519
item.description:
Report E-2024070519

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On July 12, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of sodium hydroxide was damaged by a load shift and released approximately 300-gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE crews utilized neutralizer throughout the trailer and on the concrete below, then deployed granular absorbents to the trailer and concrete, working them in with hand tools. utilized a forklift to transfer the remaining contents in the damaged tote into new one. All sodium hydroxide-impacted material was collected and containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums

item.title: Report X-2024071799
item.description:
Report X-2024071799

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Chicago Central and Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 18000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Tuesday, July 2, 2024, a CN mechanical performing an inspection observed that the bottom outlet valve appeared to be leaking from tank car # UTLX 210420 along with a strong Ethanol type odor in the area. The employee notified the Waterloo Yard Master who in turn notified the CN Dangerous Goods Team. The tank car was set out to an isolation track (WA90) for inspection by a CN emergency response contractor. A CN emergency response contractor was dispatched to the location for mitigation. The contractor performed an inspection of the tank car and found the bottom outlet valve to be leaking from the threads of the bottom outlet valve cap. It was determined that there was a failure in the sealing surface of the valve seat to include a defective gasket. (The BOV cap was found to be less than tool tight and the BOV in the closed position and pinned upon initial inspection). CN emergency response contractor did observe cable seal to be correctly in place. The BOV cap was removed, and it was observed to be leaking past the closed ball. The BOV valve handle was cycled several times to the open and closed position to free any debris that may have been trapped in the BOV sealing surface potentially causing the leak. The BOV cap was then removed and observed for 20 minutes to ensure there was no further leakage from the valve. It was noted that the BOV cap gasket was deformed and was replaced. The bottom outlet valve cap was then re-installed and tightened with a 36" pipe wrench. Upon tightening the BOV cap, CN emergency response contractor proceeded to place new cable seals on the BOV / Cap.

item.title: Report X-2024071685
item.description:
Report X-2024071685

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-23
  • City: Harahan
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 17700
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 06-23-2024 a CN Mechanical employee detected a strong foul odor emanating from tank car # GLNX 23299 containing UN 1993/Crude Sulfate Turpentine/Class 3/PG II while performing work on the repair track at the CN Mays Yard in Harahan, LA. The employee notified his supervisor who in turn made notification to the CN Dangerous Goods Team that initiated a response. The on-duty CN Dangerous Goods Officer dispatched an emergency response contractor to the location to investigate. The responding contractor noted a strong odor upon arrival to the rail car's location. There were no visible liquid leaks observed. The inspection of the top fittings revealed the manway cover gasket protruding from the manway cover. A 4-gas meter with a PID sensor detected 16 PPM of VOC's at the sealing surface of the manway cover. The shipper security seal was found to be intact upon arrival. The manway cover security seal was removed, and the cover opened for the purpose of inspecting the gasket. The inspection revealed the gasket to be torn preventing a proper seal allowing the product vapors to escape. The gasket was replaced followed by the re-securement of the swing bolts. The area was tested again with the gas meter which was non-detect for VOC's. A replacement security seal was applied to the manway cover. The liquid and air valves within the protective housing were also inspected for proper securement prior to deeming the rail car safe for continued transportation. The rail car was released back to the transportation department for continued transportation to destination.

item.title: Report E-2024070523
item.description:
Report E-2024070523

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: HILLSBOROUGH
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ACV ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Tanker was parked over gravel/dirt portion of private property at our facility in Rahway, NJ. Lading was Waste Corrosive liquid, nos in a specification DOT-407 cargo tank constructed of stainles steel, which is an authorized package and compatible with the lading. Driver parked loaded tanker in our yard and didn't ensure the internal valve was fully closed before leaving. Blank flange cap on end of wet line had been recently replaced and mistakenly was replaced with an aluminum cap. Lading was leaking slowly through ajar internal valve into wet line and corroded aluminum blank flange cap from within. Corrosion to point of spillage and approx. 50 gallons of lading leaked onto the ground. Product was cleaned up and site remediated by in-house labor and materials. Mechanical repairs to trailer and subsequent testing underway as of this reporting.

item.title: Report I-2024070016
item.description:
Report I-2024070016

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: BENTONVILLE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: REPUBLIC AIRWAYS HOLDINGS INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Passenger purchased gas generator at a Lowes in New Jersey on 5/27/2024 in an effort to use for disaster relief in Northwest Arkansas. She was under the impression that the unit was new because it was packaged that way and she had no reason to believe otherwise. There were no fumes or noticeable stains on the box. She presented it to the American Airlines ticket counter in PHL for her AA 4602/4342 PHL-LGA-XNA flights operated by Republic Airways, Inc. TSA scanned the item in PHL before being loaded on the aircraft and no dangerous goods were present. Ground crew in PHL loaded it on the aircraft. The unit shipped to LGA and no noticeable spills or fumes were observed by LGA ground crew and the package continued to XNA. Once in XNA ground crew noticed approximately 1 qt leaked on the cargo floor and some luggage. Republic Ops, Maintenance and Dangerous Goods were contacted immediately. On call maintenance contractors for Republic Airways were called out and cleaned the aircraft quickly with several cleaning agents. The extent of gasoline spilled on the cargo floor was minimal.

item.title: Report E-2024070505

item.title: Report I-2024070060
item.description:
Report I-2024070060

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-20
  • City: Farmville
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: REV LNG LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver noticed LNG was Ieaking from the rear cabinet of the MC-338 tanker after he stopped. Bystanders called 911 before the driver could. Farmville Fire Department arrived on scene and would not allow the driver to open the back doors of his transport tanker to determine the source of the leak or to prevent further Ieaking. Farmville FD contacted the state emergency hazmat team and waited for their response. Upon arrival, the state hazmat team noted that the leak had stopped and that there was no danger or threat and allowed the driver to open up the rear doors. The driver ascertained that the leak was coming from a flange to flange connection behind the discharge valve of the transport and waited for a company technician to arrive.
